ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis (Age-related hearing loss)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient is 76 years old with gradual, progressive, bilateral sloping sensorineural hearing loss and no history of noise exposure.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear Pathology (e.g., Vestibular Schwannoma)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss (Right worse than Left) and disproportionately poor word recognition in the Right ear warrant exclusion of retrocochlear causes.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear Synaptopathy / Hidden Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Difficulty in noise and poor speech clarity despite moderate thresholds, though usually associated with noise history which is denied here.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To rule out outer ear pathology or cerumen impaction.
To determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Bilateral asymmetric sloping sensorineural hearing loss (Right worse than Left) with normal middle ear function. Speech recognition is reduced bilaterally, with the Right ear showing poorer scores (64%) than the Left (74%), consistent with its poorer thresholds.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral sloping sensorineural hearing loss; Asymmetric (Right thresholds poorer than Left by 20-30 dB).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Reduced Word Recognition Scores (Phoneme scoring): Right 64%, Left 74% at 85 dB HL.

proposed_items: Medical clearance from ENT due to asymmetry
Assistive listening devices (e.g., for TV or phone)
counseling_actions: Explain the permanent nature of the sensorineural hearing loss.
Discuss the asymmetry in hearing thresholds and the need for medical referral to rule out other causes.
Counsel on realistic expectations for hearing aids given the reduced speech clarity (WRS), especially in the right ear.
Discuss the link between hearing loss and tinnitus, and how amplification often provides relief.
Recommend communication strategies for noisy environments.

red_flags_present: Subjective difficulty with phone use on the Right ear

escalation.rationale_short: Asymmetric hearing loss is a red flag for retrocochlear pathology and requires medical clearance (likely MRI) before proceeding with long-term amplification management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Proceed with hearing aid fitting and verification once medical clearance is obtained.

expected_outcome: Medical evaluation likely to be negative for retrocochlear pathology (statistically most probable), but must be confirmed.
Patient proceeds to hearing aid fitting.
Improved audibility and communication, though clarity issues may persist in noise due to cochlear distortion/reduced WRS.
